intro: Ceropegia cathcartensis, commonly known as the Cathcart's ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant blooms that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect sunlight. Ceropegia cathcartensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
